channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: UPDATED: RNC Platform Committee Adopts Slimmed-Down Party Platform, Eliminates Two Major Points
House Dems calling for Biden to step down won't say if they'll back him in general election
item.description: Multiple House Democrats who are publicly calling on President Biden to bow out of the 2024 race would not say whether they'd support him if he became the nominee.

item.title: Gavin Newsom Works to Bolster Biden in Swing-State Tour That Could Boost Both
item.description: For years, Gavin Newsom stayed far away from New Hampshire by design.The ambitious California governor understood that any visit to a bastion of presidential politics would fuel speculation that he might be eyeing President Joe Biden's job. But on Monday, with Biden...

item.title: BREAKING: White House Releases Letter From President Biden's Physician Regarding Neurologist's WH Visits
Schumer silent as worries over Biden’s fitness swell in Senate
item.description: Sen. Chuck Schumer would not answer questions about Biden's debate performance or concerns among Democrats about his candidacy.

item.title: Rep. Luna to Newsmax: AG Garland Should Pay $10K Daily Fines
item.description: Rep. Anna Paulina Luna, R-Fla., has introduced a revised "inherent contempt" resolution targeting Attorney General Merrick Garland, proposing daily fines of $10,000 for noncompliance with a House subpoena.

item.title: 'Cause for Concern': CNN Medical Analyst Tells Jake Tapper Biden Should've Been Tested Post-Debate
Senate Dems to discuss Biden’s candidacy at caucus meeting amid growing concerns
item.description: Senate Democrats are expected to discuss President Biden and his status on the Democrat presidential ticket on Tuesday during a regularly scheduled meeting.

item.title: Rep. Roger Williams to Newsmax: Chicago Needs Law Enforcement Back
item.description: Rep. Roger Williams, R-Texas, told Newsmax on Monday that Chicago is "a poster child" for allowing bad people to have guns, adding that a return to a robust criminal justice system is what the city needs, not a referendum on guns.

item.title: About Joe Biden's $100 Million Reasons to Stay in the POTUS Race...
Teachers' union president who gave viral 'off-the-rails' speech has visited Biden White House over 20 times
item.description: The president of the the largest teachers' union in the United States, who recently went viral for an "off-the-rails" speech, has visited the Biden White House dozens of times.

item.title: AOC Backs Biden as Dem Nominee, Says 'Matter Closed'
item.description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-N.Y., a member of "the Squad" of extreme-left Democrats, said Monday she is firmly behind President Joe Biden remaining the party's presidential nominee and considers the matter closed.

item.title: Jill Biden Loses It on Reporters as She Campaigns (While Joe Stays Home)
Biden's physician says neurologist visited White House as part of annual examinations
item.description: President Biden's physician said Monday that a neurologist who specializes in Parkinson's disease visited the White House as part of his annual physical examinations.

item.title: Comer to Newsmax: Is Biden's Doc Protecting Himself?
item.description: Rep. James Comer, R-Ky. questioned whether Joe Biden's physician, Dr. Kevin O'Connor, has been forthright regarding the president's cognitive state or if he's trying to protect himself because of his alleged involvement in the Biden family's influence peddling schemes.
